Art. 4.15. 
Degrees and strains in the event of substitution
Substitution takes place even where none of the successors in the same degree comes to the succession, either because they died before or at the same time as the deceased, or because they have renounced or are unworthy. It takes place even if the descendants are in equal or unequal degrees.
 In all cases of substitution, the division is made by stock. If the same stock has produced several branches, the division is also made by stock in each branch, and the members of the same branch share among themselves by head.
